about.copy: I help innovative leaders de-risk, prototype, and position frontier technologies.
about.workCopy: My work delivers productized hw/sw automations, defensible intellectual property, and/or enterprise strategies that bring applied science to market.

clients.intro: I have worked with leadership teams and innovation teams large and small.

talks.text: How to prepare for the AI future in Automotive Design. Car Design News Talk.
Building AI strategy. Talk for Automotive Innovation Forum 2025.
Harnessing new technologies towards a balanced human/machine relationship. (Closed talk for Richemont).
Solving business problems with AI. Toronto Machine Learning Workshop.

articles: Six Steps to Social Product Design - April 1, 2020
Consumer Gradient Ascent: AI for Requirements Engineering - April 1, 2020
Large Language Models: The Opportunity for Manufacturers - April 1, 2020
Design Ethics for a Machine Age - April 1, 2020
Brains, Brawn, and Beauty in Robotics - April 1, 2020

projects.title: Luxury Retail Operations
projects.summary: Exec workshop on automation trajectories & workforce impact (40k employees).
projects.situation: Executive leadership of the world's third largest luxury conglomerate, Richemont, sought guidance on how to strategically prepare their brands for rapid advances in automation.
projects.action: Collaborated with Gentle Systems (formerly PCH Innovations) to design a workshop that helped executive leadership understand automation technology trajectories and their potential impact on a 40,000-person workforce.
projects.result: Delivered workshop for C-level representation from a selection of Richemont's 28 brands, including leadership operations, finance, HR, marketing, etc.
projects.lesson: People care about human problems more than they care about technology.

projects.title: Additive Machine Scoping
projects.summary: Due diligence & system proposal for reactive extrusion manufacturing.
projects.situation: A small team at Nike Innovation developing textile manufacturing processes required technical due diligence on a novel reactive extrusion manufacturing process.
projects.action: Developed a technology readiness assessment, system architecture proposal, and prototyping strategy for a novel additive manufacturing system.
projects.result: Innovation leadership was presented with a risk-adjusted development strategy and budget for an experimental machine.
projects.lesson: Everyone wants their problems clarified and a pathway to address them.

projects.title: Manufacturing Process Automation
projects.summary: Enterprise NLP app to accelerate sales-to-fabrication document workflows.
projects.situation: Factory manager in Berlin needed to accelerate various sales engineering processes related to the production of complex high-energy switchgear equipment.
projects.action: Led a small team at Gentle Systems (formerly PCH Innovations) to develop an application to automate document processing workflows between sales and fabrication teams.
projects.result: Delivered and deployed a scalable enterprise NLP application that accelerates the configuration of machinery build orders across factories in Germany.
projects.lesson: Optimistic spirit can overcome bureaucracy.

projects.title: 3D GenAI startup (BlankAI)
projects.summary: Productized early 3D GenAI; pivoted to partnership; sold tech & team to Autodesk.
projects.situation: Innovation strategy studio investing into a generative AI exploration project and needed a commercialization pathway.
projects.action: Led a team at Gentle Systems (formerly PCH Innovations) to productize and commercialize early 3D GenAI research.
projects.result: Pivoted to corporate partnership after failed seed raise and spinout. Sold tech and team to Autodesk, where I now lead the integration of AI features into industry-leading design tools, Alias and VRED. Autodesk lays the foundations for AI
projects.lesson: Understand and protect your worth.

projects.title: Cardiac Ultrasound Probe Development
projects.summary: Mechanical development for AI-driven volumetric cardiac ultrasound systems.
projects.situation: Imaging startup commercializing an AI-driven ultrasound 3D reconstruction method that enables volumetric cardiac imaging at a fraction of the cost of MRI.
projects.action: Led mechanical development for all prototype and production systems.
projects.result: Helped released multiple versions of their volumetric imaging system released to hospitals worldwide.
projects.lesson: Distilling and communicating the constraints of a problem is half the solution.

projects.title: AI Research Collaboration
projects.summary: Collaboration to publish characterization of prior 3D GenAI research.
projects.situation: After failing to raise seed capital, NVIDIA poached my lead researcher. In an effort to continue pushing the state of our research, we pursued a collaboration.
projects.action: Facilitated collaboration agreements between NVIDIA and Gentle Systems researchers.
projects.result: Our teams published a paper characterizing the research developed at Gentle Systems (formerly PCH Innovations). XDGAN: Multi-Modal 3D Shape Generation in 2D Space
projects.lesson: Bitter lemons can make sweet lemonade.

projects.title: Circular R&D Strategy
projects.summary: Framework aligning circularity trends & regulation to automotive HPC roadmaps.
projects.situation: Engineering leadership team at Continental sought insight into technology and business model innovations that could advance the material circularity of their mobility product portfolio.
projects.action: Supported a team of sustainability experts at Gentle Systems (formerly PCH Innovations) in the development of a framework for contextualizing technology trends and sustainability regulation into the context of automotive high-performance computing products.
projects.result: Delivered a framework for circular product R&D roadmap planning.
projects.lesson: People will pay you well for a compass that navigates their complexity.

projects.title: Presentation Attack Detection
projects.summary: Red-team guidance & spoofing overview for Orb iris-recognition system.
projects.situation: Founding member of a startup building a solution for proof-of-personhood was seeking spoofing strategies for their Orb - an open source iris recognition system.
projects.action: Created an overview of state-of-the-art iris ID spoofing research and advised on hiring strategy for specialist red-team.
projects.result: Delivered research insights and talent recommendations to leadership.
projects.lesson: Ambitious, optimistic physicists who can speak well are seemingly unstoppable.

projects.title: Sustainable Design Narrative
projects.summary: Vision & strategic narrative for regenerative product creation.
projects.situation: Innovation leadership team needing a new vision and narrative for the future of sustainable product creation.
projects.action: Led a team at Gentle Systems (formerly PCH Innovations) to develop a vision and strategic narrative for regenerative business and societal models structured to realign innovation strategy.
projects.result: Produced a strategic onboarding book for executive leadership, inspiring new marketing and research initiatives (eg. Move to Zero, Bloom Over Doom, and B.I.L.L.)
projects.lesson: Humanized science sells.

projects.title: Brain Imaging Prototype Strategy
projects.summary: Prototype & fundraising guidance for brain-injury triage device (spaceflight context).
projects.situation: Founder exploring terahertz/NIR imaging needed strategy for funding and development.
projects.action: Advised prototype plan and grant strategy; supported pitches.
projects.result: CSA Deep Space Healthcare grant won; probe concept published at IAC 2022.
projects.lesson: Scientists need product strategy guidance.

projects.title: Co-founder Matchmaking
projects.summary: Workshops to clarify priorities and identify CTO candidates.
projects.situation: Founder building smart incontinence brief needed team & technical strategy.
projects.action: Ran workshops to isolate priorities and shortlist candidates.
projects.result: CTO hired from workshop participants.
projects.lesson: Founder matchmaking is a high-stakes puzzle.

projects.title: Go-to-Market Strategy Development
projects.summary: GTM & fundraising strategy for GPU cost-management tech.
projects.situation: Technical founder needed product and fundraising guidance.
projects.action: Guided requirement validation, early customer engagement, and pitch creation.
projects.result: Applied to Germany AI incubator.
projects.lesson: Technologists need communication training.

projects.title: Structural Response Simulation
projects.summary: Vibration analysis and mitigation recommendations for hybrid rocket test stand.
projects.situation: Lab-scale hybrid rocket stand exhibited unstable vibrations.
projects.action: Built simulations from vibration data; recommended instrumentation and protocols.
projects.result: Analysis supported conference presentation.
projects.lesson: Signal processing is a dark art.

projects.title: High-Altitude Balloon Microsatellite
projects.summary: NSERC-backed educational prototyping kit; balloon to ~24 km.
projects.situation: Grant-supported kit for educational use.
projects.action: Developed and launched high-altitude balloon microsatellite.
projects.result: Presented at student conference in Istanbul.
projects.lesson: If you don’t ask, you don’t get.

projects.title: Film Development Technical Advisory
projects.summary: Scientific essays supporting narrative/worldbuilding on faith & AI.
projects.situation: Director exploring the boundaries of faith and synthetic intelligence.
projects.action: Guided narrative with essays blending neuroscience, metaphysics, AI, consciousness.
projects.result: Created assets for producer pitch discussions.
projects.lesson: Exploring science through art is rewarding.

projects.title: Tech Scouting
projects.summary: Startup/academic pipeline build for research grants & partnerships.
projects.situation: Director of a corporate research facility required a pipeline of qualified startups, academic teams, and industry partners to allocate grant funding effectively and validate their industry engagement strategy.
projects.action: Developed a targeted network of startups, academics, and innovation teams in North America and Europe.
projects.result: Developed several startup and academic partnerships for CTO office.
projects.lesson: The bar for "new" ideas is often lower than you think.

projects.title: Micro-Fluidic Chip Development
projects.summary: Microfluidic chip prototypes & test rigs aligned to new target market.
projects.situation: Biotech spin-out ChipCare Corporation was commercializing its multi-analyte detection research and required a new hardware product architecture to support a strategic shift in target market—from HIV diagnostics to gonorrhea, syphilis, and chlamydia testing.
projects.action: Translated assay workflows into precision-molded microfluidic chip prototypes and testing instrumentation.
projects.result: Contributed to a prototype designed for rapid, point-of-care testing, improving early detection and treatment for gonorrhea, syphilis, and chlamydia. The system never made it to market.
projects.lesson: Ensure alignment on the priority of problems.

projects.title: Exoskeleton Structural Redesign
projects.summary: Lightweight structural redesign for mobility-assist exoskeleton.
projects.situation: Team of roboticists developing rehabilitation solutions, at Bionik Labs, were exploring future pathways for a discontinued product line.
projects.action: Complete redesign of all structural components for an exoskeleton mobility assist device.
projects.result: Built a lightweight, functional prototype before the project was cancelled. Bummer.
projects.lesson: Avoid vanity projects.

projects.title: Microsatellite Test Hardware
projects.summary: Production fixtures and ground-station mounts for star-trackers & reaction wheels.
projects.situation: Small satellite component company, Sinclair Interplanetary, aimed to scale production of their star-tracking sensors and reaction wheels for microsatellites.
projects.action: Developed production fixtures to support quality testing of optical components. Developed mounting system for a satellite-tracking optical groundstation.
projects.result: Prototype groundstation deployed, testing hardware implemented in production. SI has since been acquired by Rocket Lab.
projects.lesson: Building a successful space company without debt or investors is possible, profitable, and rare.

projects.title: Head Trauma MRI Machine
projects.summary: Subsystem development for 0.5T low-field ER MRI.
projects.situation: Small engineering team tasked with transferring an MRI prototype into an approved and manufacturable MRI system.
projects.action: Designed, prototyped, and tested mechanical assemblies for MRI hardware, including head-coil enclosure, magnet sub-structure/enclosures, and patient support bed locking mechanisms.
projects.result: Production launch of a low-field strength (0.5T) MRI machine for emergency room trauma imaging.
projects.lesson: Maintaining good vendor relationships is critical. Pay peanuts, get monkeys.

projects.title: Pathology Automation Instruments
projects.summary: Mechanicals for Raman/OCT diagnostic prototypes to production.
projects.situation: Team of optical physicists developing various laser spectroscopy (Raman and OCT) prototypes to support diagnostic imaging of brain biopsy samples.
projects.action: Redesigned mechanical prototypes at various levels of commercial readiness to support cost-efficient scaled production.
projects.result: Launched Raman spectroscopy system into production. IP development of next-gen handheld diagnostics probes leveraging additive optics. I was awarded a patent for this work: US20180344130 A1: Micro-optical surgical probes and micro-optical probe tips and methods of manufacture therefore
projects.lesson: Federated learning is the future of disease classification at scale.

projects.title: Robotic Workflow Training Device
projects.summary: Training device to accelerate adoption of a robotic monoscope procedure.
projects.situation: Team of roboticists at Synaptive Medical developed a tool-tracking robotic monoscope to support a novel port-based neurosurgical procedure.
projects.action: Collaborated with a Duke University neurosurgeon to develop a system that accelerated adoption of new robotic workflow.
projects.result: Created a training device to support customer onboarding for robot. An expanded system concept was patented but not built. This work awarded me a patent: US20180116724A1: Multi-metric surgical simulator and methods
projects.lesson: Doctors want to invent impactful products too.

projects.title: MRI quality control device
projects.summary: FDA-cleared diffusion phantom for consistent DTI calibration.
projects.situation: Team of MR physicists needing an instrument to calibrate scan protocols (T1, T2, and DTI) on their 0.5T MRI prototype system.
projects.action: Collaborated with polymer chemist to prototype, test, and refine an effective device. We developed a scalable production process to reliably manufacture the device.
projects.result: An FDA-approved device that mimics anisotropic water diffusion in neuronal fibers, providing a consistent baseline for MR scanner calibration. This ensures reliable imaging quality, crucial for tracking neurodegenerative disease progression. This project was awarded four patents: US9880251B2: Cerebrospinal diffusion phantom US 20170035527A1: Magnetic resonance visible assembly for encoding information USD790709S1: Tube anisotropic diffusion phantom US20190065681A1: System and methods for medical device asset management via distributed ledgers We presented it at ISMRM in 2016: A novel diffusion tensor imaging phantom that simulates complex neuro-architecture for potential validation of DTI Processing
projects.lesson: Fear kills invention, but play encourages it.

projects.title: Neurosurgeon Training Device
projects.summary: MRI/CT/US-compatible tissue simulators scaled from research to production.
projects.situation: Neurosurgical device startup, Synaptive Medical, required surgical simulators to help demonstrate the value of their novel robotic imaging solution.
projects.action: Partnered with a cross-disciplinary team of polymer chemists to engineer nano-particle–doped PVA cryogels with controlled tactile and multimodal imaging properties (MRI, CT, ultrasound), advancing the program from research through scalable manufacturing.
projects.result: Launched multiple products that replace the use of cadavers in neurosurgical training programs world-wide. This work awarded me two patents: WO 2017173520: Simulated tissue products and methods US20170291359A1: Anatomical simulators produced using 3D printing
projects.lesson: Chemistry is magic.

projects.title: Prosthetic Quality Assurance
projects.summary: ISO-10328 verification hardware & protocols for scan-to-print trans-tibial prosthetics.
projects.situation: Group of researchers developing a scan-to-print process for low-cost, trans-tibial prosthetics needed to validate their solution.
projects.action: Developed mechanical testing hardware and protocols to verify the prosthetic design and fabrication process against ISO-10328 standard. Implemented system beta-test in Entebbe, Uganda.
projects.result: Validated system has been spun into a non-profit, Nia Technologies, that continues to serve amputees worldwide. Publication with Autodesk Research, presented at SIGGRAPH 2015: 3D-Printed Prosthetics for the Developing World
projects.lesson: Users want to be involved in the development of solutions to their problems.

projects.title: Turbofan Engine Structures
projects.summary: Interface management and structural design support on BR700-series engines.
projects.situation: Engineering division building structures and drives for Bombardier BR700-series turbofans.
projects.action: Managed design interfaces across engine systems; assisted in structural component design.
projects.result: Supported multiple design changes to structural engine components.
projects.lesson: Manage requirements or descend into development chaos.

projects.title: Optical Test Fixtures and Production Hardware
projects.summary: Fixtures and pneumatic jigs to ramp optical assembly production.
projects.situation: Physicist-founders commercializing a Fresnel-lens CPV product.
projects.action: Developed optical testing fixtures and pneumatic assembly jigs to support production ramp.
projects.result: Increased production led to UAE pilots and achievement of investor targets.
projects.lesson: Selling the future is core to deep-tech.
